image.altText: tower down 2

props.synopsis: Power will be cut to residents in parts of outback NSW for six-hour periods overnight, as authorities seek to secure supply to the region after transmission towers were significantly damaged when wild weather ripped across the state last week.

title.children: Outback NSW residents told to expect six-hour power cuts overnight as authorities bolster generator

image.altText: A king pigeon with colourful feathers in a pigeon loft.

props.synopsis: From wartime heroes to "rats of the sky", the reputation of pigeons has shifted across centuries, but pigeon breeders are determined to celebrate the birds' hidden talents.

title.children: The pigeon fanciers uncovering hidden secrets of a clever bird

image.altText: An older woman and man with their arms around one another holding a white dog with caravans in the background.

props.synopsis: Geoff and Barbara Calbert have brought the site back to life after a hard-fought battle following the devastating River Murray floods.

title.children: Caravan park owners thought 'the odds were insurmountable' after floods, but they're back in business

image.altText: King Charles III at Sydney airport.

props.synopsis: Two young siblings involved in a crucial bone marrow transplant have been granted a "once-in-a-lifetime" audience with King Charles III and Queen Camilla during their royal tour of Australia.

title.children: Royal wish granted as boy diagnosed with blood disorder bestows Queen Camilla with bouquet

image.altText: People standing together in front of water

props.synopsis: A coronial inquest hears South Australia Police has made changes to how officers manage detainees who make comments about suicide ideation, following the death of a well-known mental health advocate from the Riverland, William "Bill" Stockman.

title.children: SA Police change management of detainees who make comments about suicide ideation

image.altText: A student wearing a blue hat draws a picture of a man

props.synopsis: A small art project has developed into a series of collaborations in one South Australian town, where concerns about COVID had kept children and aged care residents apart.

title.children: Art rekindles relationship between town's youngest and oldest residents

image.altText: Map of Australia on a globe.

props.synopsis: Australia's falling fertility rate raises some difficult — and controversial — questions.

title.children: Australia's fertility rate is at a record low, but there's something deeper we need to talk about

image.altText: Rosemarie Consignado smiles brightly as she takes a photo with the Federation University signboard in Ballarat, Victoria.

props.synopsis: As the federal government moves to cut back on international students in big cities, these students from India, Czechia and the Philippines reveal how they've embraced life at regional universities.

title.children: Why these international students are glad to be studying at regional universities

image.altText: A picture of two women superimposed together

props.synopsis: The pair arrangement between two Liberal MPs with differing views was considered crucial, given the vote on a late-term abortion bill was expected to be tight.

title.children: How a pear-shaped pair exposed fractures within the SA Liberal Party

image.altText: Sketches of people with different coloured shirts walking across a map of Australia with a blue background

props.synopsis: As Australia's population nears 30 million, this is the story of how we got here and where we might be heading next.

title.children: Australia's growing population charts the history of our nation and offers a map of the future

image.altText: Tim Tszyu is on all fours as the referee leads Bakhram Murtazaliev away during a boxing bout.

props.synopsis: Tim Tszyu's second career defeat in a row delivers a devastating blow to his prospects, as the mental scars from his Vegas bloodbath prove more durable than the physical ones.

title.children: Shell-shocked Tim Tszyu's career on the line after shocking defeat in Orlando

image.altText: A woman stands in front of microphones.

props.synopsis: The leader of the Canberra Liberals has expressed agreement with suggestions that some in her party would rather wage internal ideological battles than secure electoral victory in the ACT.

title.children: Canberra Liberals leader agrees party too far to the right following ACT election loss

image.altText: A map shows the location of Sapelo Island, on the east coast of the US

props.synopsis: The gangway collapses at a ferry dock on Cultural Day, an annual event spotlighting the island's tiny community founded by former slaves after the Civil War.

title.children: Gangway collapses in US state of Georgia, killing ferry travellers amid cultural festival on Sapelo Island

image.altText: Police man with gun walks near car

props.synopsis: It is not clear if the house was hit, but a spokesperson says neither the prime minister nor his wife were home at the time.

title.children: Israel says drone launched towards Benjamin Netanyahu's house

image.altText: Prabowo Subianto at a lectern with his hands held out.

props.synopsis: Indonesia's Prabowo Subianto takes over as president of the world's third-largest democracy today, months after sweeping the country's election with policies such as free meals for school children.

title.children: Former special forces commander Prabowo Subianto sworn in as Indonesian president

image.altText: A TV still of Kitty Flanagan sitting at a desk, wearing glasses and a loose brown suit. She has a bemused expression.

props.synopsis: Much-loved comedian Kitty Flanagan talks about the hard road to getting her ABC TV sitcom Fisk made, and how the show has taken off both in Australia and overseas.

title.children: The 'lightning in a bottle' that took Fisk from Kitty Flanagan's pipe dream to international hit

image.altText: A young woman and young man stand beside their mother.

props.synopsis: Lisa Marie Presley was working on a memoir about her life in the spotlight when she died. Her daughter, actor Riley Keough, describes how she managed to complete it.

title.children: 'Wasn't able to recover': Lisa Marie Presley lived through many tragedies. She couldn't get past her son's death

image.altText: Donald Trump smiles

props.synopsis: Experts say that while Donald Trump and the Republican party say IVF treatments in the US are not at risk, signs are pointing otherwise.

title.children: These two events have ignited debate over IVF in the US

image.altText: Man driving sprayer

props.synopsis: WA sprayer operator Rob Mitchell says a growing number of drivers are mistakenly interpreting his signal to turn right as an opportunity to pass him, with dangerous consequences.

title.children: An unwritten 'country code' is putting Rob's life at risk on the road, and all he's doing is turning right

image.altText: Liam Payne photographed in Paris in March 2024.

props.synopsis: Former One Direction singer Zayn Malik says the dates for the US leg of his Stairway to the Sky tour will be rescheduled for January.

title.children: Zayn Malik postpones tour after death of Liam Payne

image.altText: a young man in a white t-shirt

props.synopsis: Scientists have developed tiny biological bridges, each made up of millions of nasal cells, which they hope will encourage nerve cells to regenerate and grow over a patient's spinal cord injury.

title.children: Human trial to treat patients paralysed by spinal injury with cells transplanted from their nose

image.altText: Andrew Barr drinks a beer

props.synopsis: The ACT election result is another confirmation of how different Canberra is to the rest of the country, having just voted in a seven-term government, which would almost be impossible in any other jurisdiction.

title.children: If 23 years was considered a 'forever government,' how will the ACT describe Labor after 27?

image.altText: Grace Nweke and Courtney Bruce contest for the ball.

props.synopsis: Australia will need to re-group following its comprehensive 64-50 defeat to a formidable New Zealand line-up in the first Constellation Cup Test in Wellington.

title.children: Diamonds fall to inspired Silver Ferns in Constellation Cup opener

image.altText: Marc Marquez does a shoey after winning 2024 Australian MotoGP.

props.synopsis: After falling back to 13th off the starting line, Spaniard Marc Márquez produces a flawless ride to claim his fourth Australian MotoGP win at Phillip Island.

title.children: Márquez wins Aussie MotoGP in comeback classic

image.altText: A row of guns lined up in a collector's home.

props.synopsis: The Pacific nation's gun amnesty coincided with the shooting death of a 12-year-old child — just one week after the alleged murder of a police officer.

title.children: 'Take my gun, take me with it': Samoa's gun amnesty sees limited success

image.altText: An older woman in a grey knitted jumper and an older man in a green flannelette shirt stands in their Earthship.

props.synopsis: Recent widespread power outages in Tasmania had absolutely no effect on the couple, who generate their own electricity using solar panels, and only use an estimated 2 kWh per day.

title.children: Storms and power outages highlight benefits of living off-grid, as couple kept 'living life as normal'

image.altText: Early voting Queensland

props.synopsis: With so many Queenslanders now opting to vote early, it doesn't make sense for the political parties to wait until the home stretch of the election campaign to unveil their major initiatives.

title.children: Go hard, go early: Big pre-poll voting numbers changing how parties campaign

image.altText: Tom Gleeson stands at a podium with a wide mouth and eyes. The Hard Quiz logo is to his left.

props.synopsis: So you think you could beat a Hard Quiz contestant? Prove it. It's time to play, HARD!

title.children: Like your Sunday coffee with a side of shame? I've got the quiz for you

image.altText: Man driving sprayer

props.synopsis: WA sprayer operator Rob Mitchell says a growing number of drivers are mistakenly interpreting his signal to turn right as an opportunity to pass him, with dangerous consequences.

title.children: An unwritten 'country code' is putting Rob's life at risk on the road, and all he's doing is turning right

image.altText: Three women standing in front of a tree.

props.synopsis: More than 50 years on, Robyn Cohen still lives with the pain of having had her baby forcibly given up for adoption. She's one of a number of Tasmanian women affected by the practice who are fighting for compensation.

title.children: 'Finally, we have a voice': Victims of forced adoption practices continue push for compensation

image.altText: A man with dark hair and goatee poses in casual clothes

props.synopsis: Dr Zimbardo is remembered for an ill-fated 1971 prison study in which he recruited college-aged males to spend two weeks in a mock prison in the basement of a building on the Stanford campus.

title.children: Stanford Prison Experiment creator Philip G Zimbardo dies

image.altText: Nina Morrison reacts after kicking  goal for Geelong in its AFLW match against the Brisbane Lions.

props.synopsis: Geelong remains in the finals race following a 10-point upset of the Brisbane Lions, ending the reigning premiers' seven-match winning streak in the process.

title.children: Cats claw past Lions to keep AFLW finals hopes alive

image.altText: Black and white portrait of bearded Bram Stoker posing in an arm chair

props.synopsis: Gibbet Hill — set in a notorious crime hotspot in the English countryside and published as Bram Stoker was beginning work on Dracula — is rediscovered by an amateur historian passing the time in the National Library of Ireland.

title.children: Amateur historian turns up long-lost story by Dracula author Bram Stoker

image.altText: A close up of a child's hands holding a mobile phone, with a game on the screen. In the background is a computer keyboard.

props.synopsis: For many people, smartphones are an essential part of life, but in the city of St Albans, some parents have pledged to keep them out of their children's hands until they turn 14.

title.children: This small UK community noticed kids with 'TikTok brain'. Giving them a 'brick phone' could be the solution
